channel.title: Biome Makeover on
channel.description: Recent content in Biome Makeover on

item.title: Altar
item.description: ![[notes/images/altar.png]] The Altar was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found within Woodland Mansions or crafted.

item.title: Ancient Oak Tree
item.description: ![[notes/images/ancient_oak_tree.png]] Ancient Oak Trees were added with the Dark Forest makeover. They generate throughout the Dark Forest Biome or with Ancient Oak Saplings in 1x1 and 2x2 variants.

item.title: Ancient Oak Wood
item.description: ![[notes/images/ancient_oak_wood.png]] Ancient Oak Wood was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It is found on Ancient Oak trees throughout the biome.

item.title: Antidote
item.description: The Antidote was added with the Swamp makeover. It can be brewed with a Scuttler Tail and an Awkward Potion.

item.title: Badland Fossils
item.description: ![[notes/images/badlands_fossils.png]] Badlands Fossils were added with the Badlands makeover. These are a version of the vanilla game’s fossils, brought to the surface.

item.title: Barrel Cactus
item.description: ![[notes/images/barrel_cactus.png]] Barrel Cactus was added with the Badlands makeover. It is found throughout the Badlands biomes and comes in two variants - flowered and unflowered.

item.title: Black Thistle
item.description: ![[notes/images/black_thistle.png]] Black Thistle was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found growing in Dark Forests. Like other two tall flowers, it can be bonemealed to yield another Foxglove.

item.title: Blighed Cobblestone
item.description: ![[notes/images/blighted_cobblestone.png]] Blighted Cobblestone was added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. It can be obtained by crafting Cobblestone along with Mycelium Roots.

item.title: Blighed Stone Bricks
item.description: ![[notes/images/blighted_stone_bricks.png]] Blighted Stone Bricks were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. It can be obtained by crafting Stone Bricks along with Mycelium Roots or from Blighted Cobblestone.

item.title: Blighted Balda
item.description: ![[notes/images/blighted_balsa.png]] Blighted Balsa Trees were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They generate throughout the Mushroom Fields Biome or with Blighted Balsa Sapling.

item.title: Blighted Balsa Wood
item.description: ![[notes/images/blighted_balsa_wood.png]] Blighted Balsa Wood was added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. It is found on Blighted Balsa trees throughout the biome.

item.title: Block of Illunite
item.description: ![[notes/images/illunite_block.png]] The Block of Illunite is part of the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found in Illunite Fissures or crafted with 9 Illunite Shards.

item.title: Bottle o' Lightning
item.description: Bottle o’ Lightning were added with the Swamp makeover. They are obtained by interacting with a Lightning Bug while holding a Bottle o’ Enchanting or by finding them within Sunken Ruins.

item.title: Budding Illunite
item.description: Budding Illunite is part of the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found in Illunite Fissures. Over time, this block will grow new Illunite Buds before they fully grow into [Illunite Clusters][notes/block/illunite_cluster].

item.title: Bulbus Root
item.description: Bulbus Roots were added with the Dark Forest makeover. Bulbus Roots can be obtained as a guaranteed drop from Rootlings.

item.title: Buttonbush
item.description: ![[notes/images/buttonbush.png]] Buttonbushes were added with the Swamp makeover. It can be naturally found growing in swamps. Like other two tall flowers, it can be bonemealed to yield another Buttonbush.

item.title: Cladded Armor
item.description: ![[notes/images/cladded_armor.png]] Cladded Amor was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found within Woodland Mansions or crafted with Leather Armor and Crude Cladding in a Smithing Table.

item.title: Cladded Stone
item.description: ![[notes/images/cladded_stone.png]] Cladded Stone was added with the Dark Forest makeover. Cladded Stone is used in the construction of Stone Golems.

item.title: Cooked Glowfish
item.description: Raw Glowfish was added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. Bulbus Roots can be obtained by cooking Raw Glowfish Food Stats Stat Value Nutrition 5 Saturation 0.

item.title: Cowboy Hat
item.description: ![[notes/images/cowboy_hat.png]] The Cowboy Hat was added with the Badlands makeover. It can be naturally found within Ghost Towns or as a drop from Marauders.

item.title: Crude Cladding
item.description: Crude Cladding was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found within Woodland Mansions or crafted. It is used as a crafting ingredient in:

item.title: Curses
item.description: Biome Makeover adds several curses. All of them are available through the Curse Enchanting mechanic. Decayed always spawn with a Shield enchanted with the Curse of Decay.

item.title: Dried Peat
item.description: ![[notes/images/dried_peat.png]] Dried Peat was added with the Swamp makeover. It can be obtained by cooking Peat in a furnace. Dried Peat can be used as furnace fuel, burning for 500 seconds (10000 ticks).

item.title: Dried Peat Bricks
item.description: ![[notes/images/dried_peat_bricks.png]] Dried Peat Bricks were added with the Swamp makeover. It has 3 types: Dried Peat Mossy Dried Peat Cracked Dried Peat

item.title: Ectoplasm
item.description: Ectoplasm was added with the Badlands makeover. Ectoplasm can be obtained as a drop from Ghosts. They can be used to craft the Poltergeist.

item.title: Enchanted Totem of Undying
item.description: The Enchanted Totem of Undying is obtained from the Adjudicator. Like the vanilla Totem of Undying, if the totem is in your hands when your health reaches 0, it will prevent your death.

item.title: Foxglove
item.description: ![[notes/images/fox_glove.png]] Foxglove was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found growing in Dark Forests. Like other two tall flowers, it can be bonemealed to yield another Foxglove.

item.title: Glowshroom Stew
item.description: Glowshroom Stew was added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. It is crafted by combining Purple, Green and Orange Glowshrooms along with a Bowl.

item.title: Green Glowshroom
item.description: ![[notes/images/green_glowshroom.png]] Green Glowshrooms were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They can be naturally found in caves under the Mushroom Fields biome.

item.title: Huge Glowshroom Blocks
item.description: ![[notes/images/glowshroom_blocks.png]] Glowshroom Blocks generation alongside Huge Glowshrooms. There is a cap block for each Glowshroom variety, Purple, Green and Orange as well as the Glowshroom Stem block, that generates with every type.

item.title: Huge Green Glowshroom
item.description: ![[notes/images/huge_glowshrooms.png]] Huge Glowshrooms were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They can either be grown from Purple, Green and Orange Glowshrooms or the Green and Purple variants may be rarely found underground.

item.title: Illunite Bud
item.description: ![[notes/images/illunite_cluster.png]] Illunite Buds were added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found in Illunite Fissures, growing on Budding Illunite.

item.title: Illunite Cluster
item.description: ![[notes/images/illunite_cluster.png]] Illunite Clusters were added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found in Illunite Fissures after growing from a Illunite Bud or as a reward from Witch Quests

item.title: Illunite Shard
item.description: Illunite Shards are obtained from the following sources: Breaking a fully grown Illunite Cluster As a rare drop from Evokers From Witch Quests Illunite Shards are used in:

item.title: Itching Ivy
item.description: ![[notes/images/itching_ivy.png]] Itching Ivy was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found growing on the canopy of Dark Oak trees, spreading from Moth Blossoms.

item.title: Ivy
item.description: ![[notes/images/ivy.png]] Ivy was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found growing on Ancient Oak trees and on Woodland Mansions.

item.title: Lightning Bug Bottle
item.description: ![[notes/images/lightning_bug_bottle.png]] Lightning Bug Bottles were added with the Swamp makeover. The can be obtained by capturing a Lightning Bug] in a Glass Bottle or found in Sunken Ruins.

item.title: Marigold
item.description: ![[notes/images/buttonbush.png]] Marigolds were added with the Swamp makeover. It can be naturally found growing in swamps. Like other two tall flowers, it can be bonemealed to yield another Marigold.

item.title: Mesmerite
item.description: ![[notes/images/mesmerite.png]] Mesmerite was added with the Dark Forest makeover. Mesmerite can be found as part of Illunite Fissures. It can be crafted into Polished Mesmerite.

item.title: Moth Blossom
item.description: ![[notes/images/moth_blossom.png]] Moth Blossom was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be naturally found growing on the canopy of Dark Oak trees along with Itching Ivy.

item.title: Moth Scales
item.description: Moth Scales were added with the Dark Forest makeover. Moth Scales can be obtained as a drop from Moths. They can be used to brew the Potion of the Nocturnal, a potion that will keep Phantoms away.

item.title: Multipotions
item.description: MultiPotions was added with the Swamp makeover. These potions can not be brewed, but are rewards from Witch Quests. Dragon’s Breath or Gun Powder can be added to create Lingering or Splash variants.

item.title: Mushroom Bricks
item.description: ![[notes/images/mushroom_bricks.png]] Mushroom Bricks were added in the Mushroom Fields makeover Mushroom Bricks can be crafted from any Huge Mushroom or Huge Glowshroom Block.

item.title: Music Discs
item.description: Each makeover adds its own Music Disc. All songs were obtained under permissive licences that allow distribution, for that we thank the artists involved.

item.title: Mycelium Bonemealing
item.description: Bonemealing Mycelium blocks can yield the following: Mycelium Sprouts Mycelium Roots Purple Glowshroom Green Glowshroom Orange Glowshroom (Underwater only) Red Mushroom Brown Mushroom

item.title: Mycelium Roots
item.description: ![[notes/images/mycelium_roots.png]] Mycelium Roots were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. It can be naturally found growing throughout the biome. New Mushroom Roots can be generated when Bonemealing Mycelium.

item.title: Mycelium Sprouts
item.description: ![[notes/images/mycelium_sprouts.png]] Mycelium Sprouts were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. It can be naturally found growing throughout the biome. New Mushroom Sprouts can be generated when Bonemealing Mycelium.

item.title: Orange Glowshroom
item.description: ![[notes/images/orange_glowshroom.png]] Orange Glowshrooms were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They can be naturally found under the water surrounding the Mushroom Fields biome.

item.title: Paydirt
item.description: ![[notes/images/paydirt.png]] Paydirt was added with the Badlands makeover. It is found throughout the Badlands biomes, near bodies of water. Paydirt can be broken with a shovel to receive either Dirt, or various Raw Ore, Nuggets or Gems.

item.title: Peat
item.description: ![[notes/images/peat_blocks.png]] Peat was added with the Swamp makeover. It comes in two forms, Mossy Peat and Peat. It generates in the Swamp biomes and has several uses.

item.title: Peat Farmland
item.description: ![[notes/images/peat_farmland.png]] Peat Farmland was added with the Swamp makeover. Peat farmland is created when a Hoe is used on Peat or Mossy Peat.

item.title: Petals
item.description: Petals are items that can be crafted into their color-appropriate Dye. Obtaining Rootlings The following petals can be obtained from shearing Rootlings:

item.title: Poltergeist
item.description: ![[notes/images/poltergeist.png]] The Poltergeist block was added with the Badlands makeover. It can be crafted from Ectoplasm, Phantom Membranes, Soul Soil and a Cauldron.

item.title: Potion of the Nocturnal
item.description: The Potion of the Nocturnal was added with the Dark Forest makeover. It can be brewed with Moth Scales and an Awkward Potion.

item.title: Projectile Resistance
item.description: Projectile Resistance is an attribute that: Decreases the damage taken from projectiles Has a chance to block projectile damage entirely Cladded Armor is currently the only way to obtain this effect in Biome Makeover.

item.title: Purple Glowshroom
item.description: ![[notes/images/purple_glowshroom.png]] Purple Glowshrooms were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They can be naturally found in caves under the Mushroom Fields biome.

item.title: Raw Glowfish
item.description: Raw Glowfish was added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. Bulbus Roots can be obtained as a guaranteed drop from Glowfish.

item.title: Reeds & Cattails
item.description: ![[notes/images/reeds_cattails.png]] Reeds & Cattails were added with the Swamp makeover. Reeds & Cattails are two blocks that generate in shallow water of Swamp biomes.

item.title: Roasted Bulbus Root
item.description: Roasted Bulbus Roots were added with the Dark Forest makeover. Bulbus Roots can be obtained by cooking Bulbus Roots. Food Stats Stat Value Nutrition 5 Saturation 0.

item.title: Rootling Seeds
item.description: Rootling Seeds were added with the Dark Forest makeover. Rootling Seeds can be obtained as a drop from Rootlings. Rootling Seeds can be planted like any other seed.

item.title: Rootling Seeds
item.description: Soul Embers were added with the Swamp makeover. They can be used as a replacement for blaze powder in brewing stands.

item.title: Saguaro Cactus
item.description: ![[notes/images/saguaro_cactus.png]] Saguaro Cactus was added with the Badlands makeover. It is found throughout the Badlands biomes as a natural plant.

item.title: Scuttler Tail
item.description: Scuttler Tails were added with the Badlands makeover. Bulbus Roots can be obtained as a guaranteed drop from Scuttlers. They can be brewed into an Antidote.

item.title: Shocked
item.description: Shocked is a status effect that will reduce an entity’s max health while activate. When the effect is removed, the max health will be restored.

item.title: Single Dark Oak Tree
item.description: ![[notes/images/single_dark_oak.png]] Single Dark Oak Trees were added with the Dark Forest makeover. They generate throughout the Dark Forest Biome or grown with Dark Oak Saplings.

item.title: Small Lily Pad
item.description: ![[notes/images/small_lily_pads.png]] Small Lily Pads were added with the Swamp makeover. Up to 4 Small Lily Pads can be placed in a single position.

item.title: Soul Soil Composting
item.description: About Soul Soil Composting is a mechanic involving Composting and Ectoplasm. It will yield one Soul Soil for each Ectoplasm.

item.title: Stunt Powder
item.description: Stunt Powder was added with the Dark Forest makeover. Stunt Powder can be used on a baby animal to prevent it from growing into an adult.

item.title: Swamp Bonemealing
item.description: About Swamp Bonemealing is a mechanic to make some world generation only renewable through the bonemeal system. To activate Swamp Bonemealing you must use bonemeal with these conditions met:

item.title: Swamp Cypress
item.description: ![[notes/images/swamp_cypress_tree.png]] Swamp Cypress Trees were added with the Swamp makeover. They generate throughout the Swamp Biome or with Swamp Cypress Saplings.

item.title: Swamp Cypress Wood
item.description: ![[notes/images/swamp_cypress_wood.png]] Swamp Cypress Wood was added with the Swamp makeover. It is found on Swamp Cypress trees throughout the biome.

item.title: Tall Brown Mushroom
item.description: ![[notes/images/tall_brown_mushroom.png]] Tall Brown Mushrooms were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They naturally grow in small ground within the Mushroom Fields biome.

item.title: Tall Red Mushroom
item.description: ![[notes/images/tall_red_mushroom.png]] Tall Red Mushrooms were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They naturally grow in small ground within the Mushroom Fields biome.

item.title: Tapestries
item.description: ![[notes/images/tapestries.png]] Tapestries were added as part of the Dark Forest makeover. Tapestries are decorative blocks that can be found in rooms of the Mansion.

item.title: Terracotta Bricks
item.description: ![[notes/images/terracotta_bricks.png]] Terracotta Bricks were added with the Badlands makeover. Terracotta bricks come in all 16 Minecraft colors, as well as the undyed Terracotta color.

item.title: Tumbleweed
item.description: ![[notes/images/tumbleweed.png]] Tumbleweed was added as part of the Badlands makeover. It spawns around the biome and will bounce around for a short while before breaking.

item.title: Underground Mycelium
item.description: ![[notes/images/underground_mycelium.png]] Underground Mycelium Patches were added with the Mushroom Fields makeover. They can be found in caves underneath the Mushroom Fields biomes.

item.title: Water Lily
item.description: ![[notes/images/water_lily.png]] Water Lilies were added with the Swamp makeover. They can be created via Swamp Bonemealing. They can be crafted into 2 Magenta Petals

item.title: Wild Mushrooms
item.description: ![[notes/images/wild_mushrooms.png]] Wild Mushrooms were added as part of the Dark Forest makeover, but were retroactively added to the Mushroom Fields makeover.

item.title: Willow Tree
item.description: ![[notes/images/willow_tree.png]] Willow Trees were added with the Swamp makeover. They generate throughout the Swamp Biome or with Willow Saplings. The trees can generate on land on in up to 2 deep water.

item.title: Willow Wood
item.description: ![[notes/images/willow_wood.png]] Willow Wood was added with the Swamp makeover. It is found on Willow trees throughout the biome. Like all other wood types it comes with:

item.title: Willowing Branches
item.description: ![[notes/images/willowing_branches.png]] Willowing Branches were added with the Swamp makeover. Willowing Branches are generated as part of Willow Trees. They can be harvested with shears.

item.title: Witch Hat
item.description: ![[notes/images/witch_hat.png]] The Witch Hat was added with the Swamp makeover. It can be naturally found within Sunken Ruins or as a rare drop from Witches.

item.title: 🌒 Illunite Fissure
item.description: ![[notes/images/illunite_fissure.png]] Illunite Fissures was added with the Dark Forest makeover. They replaced the original “Mesmerite Boulders” that initially released with the makeover.

item.title: 🌟 Lightning Bug
item.description: ![[notes/images/lightning_bug.png]] About Lightning Bugs were added with the Swamp makeover. Behavior Lightning Bugs are an ambient mob, so they spawn randomly at all times of the day in small groups.

item.title: 🌳 Dark Forest
item.description: The Dark Forest makeover was the 4th makeover in the mod. It was originally released on the 13th of April 2021.

item.title: 🍄 Mushroom Fields
item.description: The Dark Forest makeover was the 4th makeover in the mod. It was originally released on the 11th of October 2020.

item.title: 🏇🏾 Marauder
item.description: ![[notes/images/marauder.png]] About Marauders were added as part of the Badlands makeover. If a Pillager Patrol was to spawn in the Badlands, Marauders will spawn instead.

item.title: 🏚️ Ghost Town
item.description: ![[notes/images/ghost_town.png]] About Ghost Towns were added with the Badlands makeover. Buildings within Ghost Towns are primarily made up of Terracotta and Terracotta Bricks.

item.title: 🏠 Woodland Mansion
item.description: ![[notes/images/mansion.png]] About The Woodland Mansion Rework was added as part of the Dark Forest makeover as a replacement for the vanilla Woodland Mansions.

item.title: 🐉 Dragonfly
item.description: ![[notes/images/dragonfly.png]] About Dragonflies were added with the Swamp makeover. Behavior Lightning Bugs are an ambient mob, so they spawn randomly at all times of the day.

item.title: 🐛 Report A Bug
item.description: Bug Reporting [!warning] Before reporting a bug: It’s important that you give as much information as possible when reporting a bug.

item.title: 🐡 Glowfish
item.description: ![[notes/images/glowfish.png]] About The Glowfish is an ambient water mob added by the Mushroom Fields makeover Behavior Glowfish spawn in the waters around Mushroom Field biomes.

item.title: 🐸 Swamp
item.description: The Swamp makeover was the 3rd makeover in the mod. It was originally released on the 7th of January 2021

item.title: 👻 Ghost
item.description: ![[notes/images/ghost.png]] About The Ghost is a neutral mob added as part of the Badlands makeover. Behavior Ghosts spawn in darkness inside Ghost Towns.

item.title: 💦 Sunken Ruins
item.description: ![[notes/images/sunken_ruin.png]] About Sunken Ruins were added with the Swamp makeover. They are Witch inhabited buildings that are sunken into the ground.

item.title: 💽 Installation
item.description: CurseForge The easiest way to install Biome Makeover is through the CurseForge app. Follow the instructions in their “ Creating a Custom Profile” article to get started.

item.title: 🔮 Curse Enchanting
item.description: About Curse Enchanting is done with an Altar which can either be found in the Woodland Mansion or crafted. Curse Enchanting will take one enchantment on an item, increase its level by 1 and add a random curse.

item.title: 😵 Decayed
item.description: ![[notes/images/decayed.png]] About Decayed were added with the Swamp makeover. Behavior Decayed will spawn in the swamp water a night. Decayed will attack the player on sight.

item.title: 🤠 Badlands
item.description: The Dark Forest makeover was the 4th makeover in the mod. It was originally released on the 18th of November 2020.

item.title: 🥔 Rootling
item.description: ![[notes/images/rootlings.png]] About Rootlings are added as part of the Dark Forest makeover. Part plant, part animal, the Rootling is a social creature that can either make a good snack or as a source of Petals.

item.title: 🦉 Owl
item.description: ![[notes/images/owls.png]] About The Owl is a mob added as part of the Dark Forest makeover. Owls can be tamed with any raw meat and they will fight along side you.

item.title: 🦋 Moth
item.description: ![[notes/images/moth.png]] About The Moth is a hostile mob added as part of the Dark Forest makeover. Behavior Moths will attack the player on sight.

item.title: 🦎 Scuttler
item.description: ![[notes/images/scuttler.png]] About Scuttlers are added as part of the Badlands makeover. Behavior Unless tamed, Scuttlers will flee from the player, rattling their tail.

item.title: 🧙‍♀️ Witch Quests
item.description: About Witch Quests are a mechanic where a Witch will reward you for delivering certain items. The items are traded in for a random reward.

item.title: 🧙‍♂️ Adjudicator
item.description: ![[notes/images/adjudicator.png]] About The Adjudicator was added as part of the Dark Forest makeover. This master of the Woodland Mansion is no easy fight.

item.title: 🪨 Stone Golem
item.description: ![[notes/images/stone_golem.png]] About Stone Golems are added as part of the Dark Forest makeover. Stone Golems are constructed sentries that will shoot hostile mobs for you.
